intro: Tarenna gracilipes, commonly known as the slender tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, fleshy fruits. Tarenna gracilipes is often found in moist, shaded environments within the rainforest canopy.
